div1.p: Reed discusses personal finances. He will send her money.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, May 23, 1899

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
WASHINGTON.
May 23. 1899,

div1.p:
Your
letter was received
an hour ago. If you
can wait till May 31st
I will send you gladly
the amount desired.
I had to smile when
I looked at my Bank
account, for it was
less than $10! The fact
is, I have had to pay
out on my little home
up in the mountains,
something over $400.00
since April 1st; besides
renewing my life Insu-
rance in April - So
you happened to strike
me when I was “dead
broke”, as it were!
But who ever knew
a Reed to have
any “spare change”?
Not I, nor you!

Am so sorry to hear
that Lem has had
any business reverses-
Hope that he will soon
recover- This leaves
us all well.

Best love to your
girls - Expect to hear
from me on last of
this month.
